contentList:
Anosmia -- Cold damage -- You lose your sense of smell and taste. You automatically fail any ability checks that involve your sense of smell or taste. The condition heals if you receive any magical healing. You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Anosmia is intended Cold damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you Nauseous.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Blindness -- Acid damage -- Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the blinded condition. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your sight. Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the Blinded condition.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Blindness is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness.
Intended severity: High.
Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the Blinded condition.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Blisters -- Acid damage -- You have severe blisters. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks. The blisters heal if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the blisters and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After seven successes, the blisters heal. You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Blindness is intended for Acid damage.
Intended severity: Low.
You have severe blisters. You have Disadvantage on Dexterity Ability Checks.
The condition heals when you succeed a Constitution Saving Throw after receiving healing. Destroyed foot is intended for Acid, Cold and Lightning damage. Intended severity: Medium. Your Movement Speed is halved. If you use the Dash action you fall Prone at the end of your turn. You have Disadvantage on Acrobatics checks.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Destroyed Hand is intended for Acid, Cold, Lightning and Bludgeoning damage. Intended severity: High. You are Disarmed upon being injured. You have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Strength and Dexterity Ability Checks while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. Horrible Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage. Intended severity: Medium. You have acid burns to the extent that the scars can't be easily concealed. You have Disadvantage on Persuasion checks and Advantage on Intimidation checks.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Major Neuralgia is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury just with a higher DC saving throw. Intended severity: High. You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, cures the neuralgia, or if you spend twenty days doing nothing but resting it resolves on its own. Minor Disfigurement is intended for Acid damage. Intended severity: Low. You have acid burn scars, but they don't have any adverse effect.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, remove the acid burn scar. Minor Neuralgia is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Major Neuralgia will replace Minor Neuraliga, it's the same injury just with a higher DC saving throw. Intended severity: High. You are in constant pain from nerve damage. Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, you lose your Action and can't use Reactions until the start of your next turn.
Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as Heal and Regenerate, cures the neuralgia, or if you spend twenty days doing nothing but resting it resolves on its own. Partial Blindness is intended for Acid and Cold damage. Acquiring Partial Blindness twice will induce Blindness. Intended severity: High. Your eyes are damaged; you have Disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and on ranged Attack Rolls. If you are already suffering from Partial Blindness and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the Blindness injury.
Magic such as Lesser Restoration can restore your sight. Systematic Damage is intended for Cold damage. Intended severity: High. You have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Ability Checks and Saving Throws.
Magic such as the Regenerate spell can cure the damage.
